author: nero_eth
content:
Created this PR to see how deprecating the ExecutionPayloadEnvelope would look like:
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/11295

lmk <@402080271563751435> <@427491045308235776>

author: taulepton_
content: looks good! added a comment on the PR. Will give a more in-depth review later.

author: taulepton_
content: High-level question <@792404665068158998> , in the future could we optimise the protocol so that the bid does not need to commit to a specific block? This would give them more freedom / time to generate the block?

author: nero_eth
content:
this has been discussed under "slot autction" (instead of block auction).
The problem was that proposers could commit to themselves and then sell their "right to build" a few seconds later into the slot - essentially timing games is what makes this difficult

author: taulepton_
content: ahhh ok that makes sense, thanks for the explanation

author: taulepton_
content: Is there anything wrong with the secondary market?

author: nero_eth
content: it might encourage validators to delay their proposal, not using the full time they have, thus building less full blocks

author: kevaundray
content:
Do you think its possible to ask epbs folks to include the payload header in the Bid for gloas?

I think having the struct to group all of the header fields would be easier for maintenance

author: nero_eth
content: It would make the bid larger for no immediate benefits?

author: nero_eth
content: We can still do it later on with BiB and also re-introduce while depr the ExecutionPayload

author: kevaundray
content: Makes sense -- in the PR, shouldn't the `payload_blob_count` now be in the Bid?

author: nero_eth
content: Oh, forgot this one. Yeah, will add it üëçüèº
